intro: Argentina bidentula, commonly known as the Argentine bidentula, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellowish in color. Argentina bidentula is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
